description: First term of balanced prime quartets: p(m+1)-p(m) = p(m+2)-p(m+1) = p(m+3)-p(m+2).
comments: This sequence is infinite if Dickson's conjecture holds. [_Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 23, 2011]
links: Zak Seidov and Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 4000 terms from Seidov)
prog: (PARI) p=2;q=3;r=5;forprime(s=7,1e4, t=s-r; if(t==r-q&&t==q-p, print1(p", ")); p=q;q=r;r=s) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 14 2013
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 10 2000
